title: Alisadr Cave
content: Alisadr cave is the most well-known cave in Iran. This big lake cave is situated in the north of Hamedan near the town of Kabudrahang inside the Jurassic formations. The German researchers in a visit accompanied by the experts of the Geological Survey of Iran, which was for surveying the cave, have known this case as the longest boating route among the world’s lake caves. The depth of the cave’s clear water sometimes reaches to 17m. These cave deposits are also so beautiful and scenic. The cave spaghetti-shaped stalactites can rarely be seen elsewhere. The access road and recreation facilities surrounding Alisadr cave are entirely provided.

SE7-2 :A stalagmite called “statues of father and son” or “statue of Buddha”
SE7-3 :The beautiful lake of Alisadr Cave
SE7-6 :A variety of forms in Alisadr cave’s stalactites
